newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ESTONIA-TV CHANNEL ISSUES BONDS, SEEKS LISTING - REPORT.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA-TV CHANNEL ISSUES BONDS, SEEKS LISTING - REPORT.

text.p: Estonian Independent Television, the country's smallest local TV channel, has issued 15 million kroons in bonds, the Aripaev newspaper said on Wednesday.
The issue closes on Wednesday and was organised by Tallinna Pank, the newspaper added.
It will use the issue to construct transmition centres as it wants to broaden its coverage all over Estonia, the head of the channel, Oleg Sonajalg, was quoted as saying.
Its present coverage is Tallinn and its surroundings.
The channel is also seeking a listing on the Tallinn bourse at the end of next year, the newspaper added.
